name: 12 Top Tempeh Recipes for Simple Meatless Dinners
Vegetarian Sloppy Joes
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(8 ounce) packages', 'name': 'tempeh'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetarian Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'blackstrap molasses'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'celery seed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried thyme'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'hamburger buns'}
steps: Heat oil in a deep, 10-inch skillet over medium-low heat. Cook the onion in the oil until translucent. Crumble the tempeh into the skillet; cook and stir until golden brown. Add the green pepper and garlic; cook another 2 to 3 minutes.. Stir in the tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, honey, molasses, cayenne pepper, celery seed, cumin, salt, coriander, thyme, oregano, paprika, and black pepper; stir. Simmer another 10 to 15 minutes. Spoon hot onto hamburger buns to serve.

name: Vegetarian Enchilada Casserole
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'black beans, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced green chile peppers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(6 inch)', 'name': 'corn tortillas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(19 ounce) can', 'name': 'enchilada sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced black olives'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees (175 degrees C). Lightly oil a 9x13-inch baking dish.. Combine beans, garlic, onion, chile peppers, jalapeño pepper, and tempeh in a medium bowl. Pour enchilada sauce into a shallow bowl.. Dip three tortillas in enchilada sauce, and place them in the prepared baking dish. Be sure to cover bottom of the dish as completely as possible. Place 1/2 of the bean mixture on top of the tortillas, and repeat. Drizzle remaining sauce over the casserole, and sprinkle with olives and shredded cheese.. Cover, and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover, and continue baking for an additional 15 minutes, or until the casserole is bubbling and the cheese is melted.

name: Tempeh Gyros
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground thyme'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(6 inch)', 'name': 'whole-wheat pitas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'pink Himalayan salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'cucumbers, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12.3 ounce) package', 'name': 'silken tofu'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': '(packed) fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced fresh garlic'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}
steps: Combine vegetable broth, soy sauce, lemon juice, oregano, thyme, 1 1/2 teaspoons garlic, Himalayan salt, and dash of pepper in a large bowl.. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Cut tempeh in half and add to the boiling water. Boil for 10 minutes to remove any bitter taste. Transfer tempeh to a cutting board and allow to cool slightly.. Cut tempeh into 1/4-inch slices and place them in the vegetable broth marinade. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator 8 hours to overnight, stirring occasionally to be sure tempeh is covered with marinade.. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.. Transfer marinated tempeh slices to the prepared baking sheet.. Bake in the preheated oven, turning halfway through, until golden brown and beginning to crisp at the edges, 30 to 35 minutes.. Place pitas in the hot oven until warmed through, 3 to 5 minutes.. Squeeze excess water from cucumbers using a paper towel. Place tofu, cucumbers, dill, 1 teaspoon garlic, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Blend until tzatziki is well mixed. Adjust seasonings if desired.. Assemble a gyro by placing 1/4 of tempeh slices, tomatoes, and red onions on top of a pita. Cover with tzatziki. Repeat with remaining tempeh, tomatoes, onion, and pita.

name: Tempeh Tacos
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'spicy flavored tempeh, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'taco seasoning mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground red pepper (Optional)'}
steps: Heat oil in skillet on medium-high heat. Cook and stir onion in the hot oil until it begins to soften, about 5 minutes; add garlic and continue to cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir grated tempeh into onion mixture; cook and stir until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.. Pour vegetable broth over the tempeh mixture and reduce heat to low; season with taco seasoning, oregano, and ground red pepper. Cook, stirring regularly, until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes.

name: Barbeque Tempeh Sandwiches
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'barbecue sauce, your choice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'kaiser rolls, split and toasted'}
steps: Pour the barbeque sauce into a medium bowl. Crumble the tempeh into the sauce, and let it marinate a little, about 10 minutes.. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the red and green peppers, and the onion. Cook, stirring frequently until tender. Stir in the tempeh and barbeque sauce, and heat through.. Spoon the tempeh mixture onto kaiser rolls, and serve.

name: North African Couscous with Tempeh
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'curry powder'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'liquid smoke flavoring'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'three-grain tempeh, cut into bite-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'curry powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10 ounce) box', 'name': 'plain couscous'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'chickpeas, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dried mint'}
steps: Mix 1/3 cup water, soy sauce, honey, 1 1/2 teaspoons curry powder, garlic, lemon juice, and liquid smoke together in a bowl until marinade is smooth; add tempeh and turn to coat evenly. Marinate tempeh, turning frequently, for 20 minutes.. Combine vegetable broth, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 1/2 tablespoons curry powder, and salt in a saucepan with a tight-fitting lid; bring to a boil. Add couscous, cover saucepan, and remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff couscous with a fork.. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; add tempeh and marinade. Cook tempeh until browned on the bottom, about 5 minutes. Turn and brown the other side, about 5 minutes more. Remove tempeh from skillet.. Pour remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil into the same skillet; cook and stir onion until fragrant and brown, about 4 minutes. Add chickpeas and water; cook and stir using a wooden spoon to break up brown bits of food on the skillet, 3 to 4 minutes. Reduce heat to low.. Fold couscous into the onion mixture; add tempeh. Sprinkle mint over couscous; cook and stir until warmed through, 2 to 3 minutes.

name: Tempeh Fajitas
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'corn oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, broken into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced mushrooms, drained'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped green chile peppers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dried minced onion'}
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute tempeh with soy sauce and lime juice until tempeh browns. Stir in bell peppers, mushrooms, spinach, chile peppers, cilantro and dried onion.. Increase heat to medium-high and cook until fluids have reduced, stirring occasionally.

name: Smokey Vegetarian Cuban Black Bean Soup
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dried black beans'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'yellow onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried Mexican oregano, crushed between your fingers'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced smoked tempeh bacon (such as Lightlife® Organic Smoky Tempeh Strips®)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dark rum (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeño pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced hard-boiled eggs (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped red onion'}
steps: Place black beans into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 8 hours to overnight. Drain beans and rinse with fresh water.. Heat oil in a large Dutch oven or stockpot over medium heat; cook and stir yellow onion, paprika, and cumin seeds until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add red bell pepper, green bell pepper, garlic, oregano, and bay leaves; cook and stir until onion is translucent and bell peppers are tender, 6 to 8 minutes.. Mix vegetable stock, black beans, tempeh, rum, and jalapeno pepper into onion mixture. Increase heat to medium-high, bring to a simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until beans are tender, about 45 minutes.. Pour water into bean mixture; season with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until beans begin to fall apart and soup thickens, 30 to 40 minutes; season with salt and pepper. Remove and discard bay leaves from soup.. Ladle soup into bowls and garnish with hard-boiled eggs and red onion.

name: Tempeh Mock Tuna Salad
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'seaweed flakes or granules'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped dill pickles'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy mayonnaise'}
steps: Heat the broth to a light boil over medium-high heat. Add the tempeh to the broth, and simmer for 25 minutes. Drain and let cool to room temperature for 15 minutes. Once cooled, grate tempeh into a large bowl.. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, and seaweed flakes. Pour the seaweed mixture in with the grated tempeh and stir until well mixed. Mix in the red onion, celery, and dill pickles. Toss with the mayonnaise. This salad can be served immediately, but is best when chilled for several hours to allow the flavors to blend.

name: Vegan Banh Mi
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegan Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tamari soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'shiitake mushroom'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'fermented black bean paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced shallot'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'strip', 'name': 'nori seaweed'}, {'quantity': '4 ½', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'tempeh'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegan mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sriracha sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 inch)', 'name': 'French baguette, sliced into bite-sized cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'pickled daikon, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'pickled carrot, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber slices, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.. Warm Worcestershire sauce, tamari, water, mushroom, black bean paste, shallot, garlic clove, and seaweed in a saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and let cool. Drain sauce and discard the solids.. Place tempeh in a bowl and pour 1/3 cup of the sauce on top. Marinate for 20 minutes, turning tempeh over halfway.. Remove 1 teaspoon of the tempeh marinade and whisk together with vegan mayo and sriracha in a separate bowl. Refrigerate until needed.. Arrange baguette pieces on the prepared baking sheet and drizzle olive oil on top. Toss and arrange bread into a single layer.. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Turn bread and cook until browned, about 8 minutes more. Transfer to a bowl.. Place the tempeh on the baking sheet; reserve the liquid. Bake for 10 minutes, basting with some of the reserved marinade halfway through. Flip tempeh; bake, basting again, for 10 minutes more.. Cut tempeh into cubes. Arrange the bread, tempeh, jalapeno slices, pickled daikon, carrot, cucumber, and cilantro into serving bowls. Top with sriracha mayo.

name: Buffalo Tempeh Sliders
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(8 ounce) packages', 'name': 'tempeh, cut into 2-inch strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 fluid ounce) bottles', 'name': "Buffalo wing sauce (such as Frank's® RedHot)"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled blue cheese, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'green bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, diced, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(5.3 ounce) container', 'name': 'Greek yogurt, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '18', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pita pockets, or more to taste'}
steps: Place tempeh in a large bowl and cover with Buffalo sauce. Set aside to marinate, 10 to 20 minutes.. Remove tempeh from Buffalo sauce, reserving sauce. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook tempeh in a single layer, in batches, until heated through and lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side. Pour some Buffalo sauce back over tempeh to coat.. Combine blue cheese, cilantro, green bell pepper, celery, and onion in a large bowl. Mix in enough Greek yogurt until topping just holds together.. Divide tempeh pieces among pita pockets; top with a spoonful of the topping. Top with remaining Buffalo sauce.

name: Scooter's Vegan Tempeh Chili
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrots, cut into bite-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sweet onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': "tempeh (such as Trader Joe's® Organic 3 Grain Tempeh), crumbled"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, cut into bite-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, cut into bite-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange bell pepper, cut into bite-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'black beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'cannellini beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'red kidney beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole kernel corn, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'brown sugar'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add carrots; cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add onion and chopped garlic; cook and stir until aromatic, about 3 minutes. Add chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, and cumin; cook and stir for 1 minute. Toss in tempeh, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and orange bell pepper; cook and stir until tempeh is coated in the spices, about 5 minutes.. Pour tomatoes, black beans, cannellini beans, kidney beans, corn, and brown sugar into the tempeh mixture. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, until flavors are well blended, about 30 minutes.

name: Buffalo Tempeh Tenders
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'matzo meal'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, sliced into 1/4-inch thick slices'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Buffalo wing sauce, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'blue cheese salad dressing, or to taste'}
steps: Whip egg in a bowl for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Pour matzo meal into a separate bowl.. Dip tempeh slices in egg, then coat in matzo meal to coat completely.. Heat oil in a skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fry breaded tempeh until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to cool briefly.. Transfer tempeh to a bowl and add enough Buffalo wing sauce to cover. Cover bowl and shake until evenly coated. Serve with blue cheese dressing.

name: Tempeh Kabobs with Moroccan Couscous
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, cut into 1/2 inch squares'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh white mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'eggplant, cut into 1 inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red bell pepper, cut into 1 inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'teriyaki sauce'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh garlic'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry couscous'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'drained canned chick-peas (garbanzo beans)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon'}
steps: Place tempeh, mushrooms, eggplant, red bell pepper, and cherry tomatoes in a large resealable plastic bag. In a mixing bowl, whisk together olive oil, soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, and honey; season with 1 tablespoon ginger, 1 tablespoon garlic, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour mixture over tempeh and veggies, seal, and shake to coat. Refrigerate for 2 hours.. Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Thread tempeh and veggies on skewers. Reserve remaining marinade.. Grill skewers, turning often to make sure everything is cooked evenly. These can also be done in the broiler.. While grilling kabobs, combine vegetable stock, 1 tablespoon grated ginger, cumin, and salt. Bring to a light boil. Stir in couscous, raisins, and garbanzo beans; cover, and remove from heat. Let sit for five minutes, or until fluffy. Just before serving, squeeze lemon over couscous and stir. Serve kabobs with reserved marinade.

name: Sweet and Spicy Tempeh with Long Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'shallots, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 inch) piece', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut oil, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': '(8 ounce) packages', 'name': 'tempeh, cut into 1/8-inch strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemongrass - trimmed, flattened, and tied into knots'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'long beans, cut into bite-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fiery chili cooking oil'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'palm sugar'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'baby kale'}
steps: Combine shallots, garlic, and ginger in a mortar and pestle and grind into a spice paste.. Heat enough oil in a deep skillet for deep frying. Deep-fry tempeh until golden brown, 5 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain.. Drain most of oil from the skillet, leaving about 2 tablespoon of oil. Sauté spice paste and lemongrass until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add long beans, soy sauce, garlic-chili oil, and palm sugar. Cook until long beans are tender but still have a bit of crunch, about 2 minutes. Add baby kale and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. Remove lemongrass knot before serving.

name: Crunchy Curried Kale
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'kale, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'curry powder, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, cut into cubes'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'small corn tortillas, cut into small triangles'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat; add kale and curry powder. Cook and stir kale mixture in the hot oil until wilted, about 5 minutes. Add avocados, tempeh, and tortillas; cook and stir until dry, golden brown, and crunchy, 30 to 40 minutes.

name: Tempeh-Bean Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell peppers, halved and seeded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'cannellini beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) package', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'nutritional yeast'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil. Add red bell pepper halves, cover, and steam until just tender, 2 to 6 minutes.. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook tempeh and onion until tempeh is crispy, 5 to 10 minutes. Add cannellini beans, spinach, and broth; cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir feta cheese, nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper into stuffing.. Fill red bell pepper halves with stuffing. Place on a baking sheet.. Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, until tops are browned, about 30 minutes.

name: Tofu Scramble Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'peeled and chopped sweet potatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'coconut aminos'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) package', 'name': 'extra-firm tofu, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'nutritional yeast'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'coconut aminos'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': '1 pinch black salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'water, or more if needed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'seitan, cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'tomato, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'avocados, diced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(8 inch)', 'name': 'flour tortillas'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line a baking tray with parchment paper or a silicone liner (such as Silpat®).. Combine sweet potatoes, onion, bell pepper, lime juice, coconut aminos, garlic powder, and pepper for potatoes in a medium bowl, stirring so that everything is evenly coated. Transfer to the prepared baking tray.. Cook in the preheated oven until crisp and tender, 30 to 40 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking time.. While the potatoes are cooking, crumble the tofu into a large, nonstick pan. Add nutritional yeast, coconut aminos, garlic powder, pepper, and black salt. Cook over low heat, adding 1 tablespoon of water at a time if the tofu starts to stick, for 10 minutes. Add seitan and tomato, and cook until everything is warmed through, about 20 minutes.. Place a tortilla on a flat surface. Place some potatoes, avocado, and tofu scramble on the tortilla. Start at the bottom and fold the tortilla edge up and over the center into a wrap. Repeat to form remaining wraps.. Heat a flat-bottomed, cast iron pan over medium heat. Place the wraps in the hot pan, folded-side down. Cook until golden brown and sealed, about 4 minutes.

name: Tempeh Ratatouille
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'new potatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrot, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'eggplant, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped broccoli'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'zucchini, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'green beans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'garbanzo beans, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded pepperjack cheese'}
steps: Place the potatoes, carrot, and onion in a large saucepan, and add enough water to bring the water level to about 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Mix in eggplant, broccoli, green beans, and zucchini; simmer for 2 minutes. Mix in tempeh, vegetable broth, crushed tomatoes, and garbanzo beans. Season with rosemary and garlic. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until veggies are tender.. Ladle into bowls, and top with cheese.

name: Indonesian Ratatouille with Tempeh
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'shallots, minced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole habanero peppers (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'tomato, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'okra, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'eggplant, peeled and large diced (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'brown sugar (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Coat the bottom of a skillet with oil and place it over medium heat. Combine shallots, peppers, tomato, and garlic in the skillet and stir until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add tempeh, bell pepper, and okra; stir quickly to combine. Add broth and eggplant; bring to a low boil and cook for about 5 minutes. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until all vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in coconut milk and brown sugar. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Vegan Fajitas with Tempeh
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, cut into thick slices'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'tempeh, sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'name': 'fajita seasoning (such as McCormick®)'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add red pepper, onion, garlic, and salt. Cook and stir until fragrant, 5 to 7 minutes.. Meanwhile, mix tempeh, water, and fajita seasoning together in a shallow bowl.. Add seasoned tempeh to the skillet. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring often, until tempeh absorbs flavors, about 15 minutes. Reduce heat to low and keep warm until ready to serve.
